text: file provides guidance Claude Code (claude.ai/code) working code repository.

title: CLAUDE.md
text: csstyle R package standardizing outputs (graphs, tables, reports) using CSIDS visual guidelines. provides consistent ggplot2 themes, color palettes, formatting functions reduce output variation across projects.

title: CLAUDE.md
code: # Load package functions during development devtools::load_all(".")  # Generate documentation from roxygen comments devtools::document()  # Standard package check devtools::check()  # REQUIRED: CRAN compliance check (always run before releases) R CMD check . --as-cran  # Build and install devtools::build() devtools::install()

title: CLAUDE.md
code: # Run all tests devtools::test()  # Run specific test file testthat::test_file("tests/testthat/test_x.R")

title: CLAUDE.md
code: # Build pkgdown site pkgdown::build_site()

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Global configuration via global environment set_global() function location code formatting preferences Central colors list defining CSIDS color palettes Named colors (H1-H12) specific hex codes Palette types: primary, warning, posneg Dynamic palette generation 1-12 levels scale_color_cs() scale_fill_cs() ggplot2 integration theme_cs() - Main CSIDS ggplot2 theme Configurable grid lines, legend position, axis orientation Panel--top option layered visualizations Norwegian conventions (format_*_as_nor): comma decimal, space thousands, ‚ÄúIK‚Äù missing values Journal conventions (format_*_as_journal): decimal point, comma thousands, ‚ÄúNA‚Äù missing values Functions different contexts: percentages (_perc), per 100k rates (_per100k) Log scale transformations (_invlog2, _invlog10, _invloge) Precision variants (0, 1, 2 decimal places) Internal helper functions (format_num_as_nor, format_num_as_journal) @noRd Norwegian conventions (format_*_as_nor): ‚Äúdd.mm.yyyy‚Äù format ‚Äúkl.‚Äù prefix times Journal conventions (format_*_as_journal): ISO 8601 standard (‚Äúyyyy-mm-dd‚Äù, ‚Äúyyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss‚Äù) File-safe datetime formats systems Consistent API pattern matching number formatting functions

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Numbered files (1_, 2_, 3_): Core infrastructure loaded order Functional files: Specific feature implementations (formatting, utilities, etc.) Development folder (dev/): Experimental/prototype functions yet main package

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Consistency flexibility: Limited, standardized options rather infinite customization Dual formatting systems: Separate Norwegian (domestic) journal (international) formatting serve different audiences Consistent API patterns: Parallel function naming (format_*_as_nor vs format_*_as_journal) predictable usage CSIDS branding: visual elements follow organizational style guidelines Modular palette system: Colors defined centrally, applied consistently across functions

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Core dependencies: data.table, ggplot2, glue, magrittr, rstudioapi, stringr, csdata

title: CLAUDE.md
text: Package follows CSIDS organizational styling standards Color palette system hierarchical (primary_1 primary_12) Norwegian functions (format_*_as_nor) return ‚ÄúIK‚Äù missing values, use Norwegian conventions Journal functions (format_*_as_journal) return ‚ÄúNA‚Äù missing values, use international standards package focuses output standardization rather data analysis Versioning: Uses YYYY.MM.DD format (differs cs9 swereg packages use YY.M.D)

title: CLAUDE.md
text: package provides parallel formatting functions academic publication: Number formatting differences: - Norwegian: "1234,5", "12,3 %", "123,5 /100k", "IK" missing - Journal: "1,234.5", "12.3%", "123.5/100k", "NA" missing Date formatting differences: - Norwegian: "25.12.2023", "25.12.2023 kl. 14:30" - Journal: "2023-12-25", "2023-12-25 14:30:00" (ISO 8601) dual approach ensures consistent output domestic Norwegian reports international academic publications.

title: Introduction to csstyle
text: csstyle package provides system standardizing outputs graphs, tables, reports using CSIDS visual guidelines. Rather offering infinite customization options, csstyle focuses producing limited set outputs consistently look .

title: Introduction to csstyle
text: Consistent ggplot2 themes CSIDS styling Predefined color palettes professional visualizations Norwegian number formatting conventions Utility functions common tasks

title: Introduction to csstyle
text: main theme function theme_cs() provides clean, professional appearance:  can customize theme various options:
code: # Basic scatter plot with CSIDS theme ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = hp)) +   geom_point() +   theme_cs() +   labs(     title = "Engine Power vs Fuel Efficiency",     x = "Miles per Gallon",     y = "Horsepower"   ) # Theme with bottom legend and vertical x-axis labels ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = factor(cyl), y = mpg, fill = factor(cyl))) +   geom_boxplot() +   theme_cs(legend_position = "bottom", x_axis_vertical = TRUE) +   labs(title = "MPG by Number of Cylinders", fill = "Cylinders")

title: Introduction to csstyle
text: package includes several predefined color palettes:  Use color scales plots:
code: # View available colors head(colors$named_colors) #>        H1        H2        H3        H4        H5        H6  #> "#393C61" "#0975B5" "#2EA1C0" "#709900" "#B11643" "#FC5F56"  # Display all palettes display_all_palettes() # Using the primary color palette ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = hp, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point(size = 3) +   scale_color_cs(palette = "primary") +   theme_cs() +   labs(color = "Cylinders") # Using the warning palette for fills ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = factor(cyl), fill = factor(cyl))) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_cs(palette = "warning") +   theme_cs() +   labs(title = "Car Count by Cylinders", fill = "Cylinders")

title: Introduction to csstyle
text: package provides Norwegian number formatting conventions:
code: # Format numbers with Norwegian conventions numbers <- c(1234.56, 9876.54, 123.45, NA)  # Basic number formatting (0, 1, 2 decimal places) format_num_as_nor_num_0(numbers) #> [1] "1235" "9877" "123"  "IK" format_num_as_nor_num_1(numbers) #> [1] "1234,6" "9876,5" "123,5"  "IK" format_num_as_nor_num_2(numbers) #> [1] "1234,56" "9876,54" "123,45"  "IK"  # Percentage formatting percentages <- c(12.34, 56.78, 90.12) format_num_as_nor_perc_1(percentages) #> [1] "12,3 %" "56,8 %" "90,1 %"  # Per 100k population rates rates <- c(123.45, 678.90) format_num_as_nor_per100k_1(rates) #> [1] "123,5 /100k" "678,9 /100k"

title: Introduction to csstyle
text: Format dates using Norwegian conventions:
code: # Current date format_date_as_nor() #> [1] "21.08.2025"  # Specific dates test_date <- as.Date("2023-12-25") format_date_as_nor(test_date) #> [1] "25.12.2023"  # Datetime formatting test_datetime <- as.POSIXct("2023-12-25 14:30:00") format_datetime_as_nor(test_datetime) #> [1] "25.12.2023 kl. 14:00"  # Filename-safe datetime format_datetime_as_file(test_datetime) #> [1] "2023_12_25_143000"

title: Introduction to csstyle
text: academic publications, package also provides journal formatting functions use international conventions (comma thousands separator, decimal point, ISO 8601 dates):

title: Introduction to csstyle
code: # Compare Norwegian vs Journal formatting numbers <- c(1234.56, 9876.54, NA)  # Norwegian format (space thousands, comma decimal, "IK" for NA) format_num_as_nor_num_1(numbers) #> [1] "1234,6" "9876,5" "IK"  # Journal format (comma thousands, decimal point, "NA" for NA) format_num_as_journal_num_1(numbers) #> [1] "1,234.6" "9,876.5" "NA"  # Percentage comparison percentages <- c(12.34, 56.78)  # Norwegian: "12,3 %" vs Journal: "12.3%" format_num_as_nor_perc_1(percentages) #> [1] "12,3 %" "56,8 %" format_num_as_journal_perc_1(percentages) #> [1] "12.3%" "56.8%"  # Per 100k comparison   rates <- c(123.45, 678.90)  # Norwegian: "123,5 /100k" vs Journal: "123.5/100k" format_num_as_nor_per100k_1(rates) #> [1] "123,5 /100k" "678,9 /100k" format_num_as_journal_per100k_1(rates) #> [1] "123.5/100k" "678.9/100k"

title: Introduction to csstyle
code: test_date <- as.Date("2023-12-25") test_datetime <- as.POSIXct("2023-12-25 14:30:00")  # Norwegian format: "25.12.2023" format_date_as_nor(test_date) #> [1] "25.12.2023"  # Journal format (ISO 8601): "2023-12-25" format_date_as_journal(test_date) #> [1] "2023-12-25"  # Datetime comparison format_datetime_as_nor(test_datetime)     # "25.12.2023 kl. 14:00" #> [1] "25.12.2023 kl. 14:00" format_datetime_as_journal(test_datetime)  # "2023-12-25 14:30:00" #> [1] "2023-12-25 14:30:00"

title: Introduction to csstyle
text: Norwegian journal formats support inverse log transformations:

title: Introduction to csstyle
text: Use pretty_breaks() nicely formatted axis breaks:
code: ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = hp)) +   geom_point() +   scale_y_continuous(breaks = pretty_breaks(n = 4)) +   theme_cs()

title: Introduction to csstyle
text: Display every nth label crowded axes:
code: ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = rownames(mtcars), y = mpg)) +   geom_col() +   scale_x_discrete(breaks = every_nth(n = 4)) +   theme_cs() +   set_x_axis_vertical()

title: Introduction to csstyle
text: csstyle package provides comprehensive set tools creating consistent, professional visualizations follow Norwegian (CSIDS) international journal standards. dual formatting approach ensures : Norwegian functions (*_as_nor) follow local conventions domestic reports presentations Journal functions (*_as_journal) follow international standards academic publications providing options limiting excessive customization, package ensures consistent output formatting across different publication contexts. detailed examples function documentation, use help(package = "csstyle") refer individual function help pages.

title: Authors and Citation
text: White RA, Berg-Hansen CV, Zhang C (2025). csstyle: Standardizing Outputs 'CSIDS' Style. R package version 2025.8.21, https://www.csids./csstyle/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {csstyle: Standardizing Outputs in the 'CSIDS' Style},   author = {Richard Aubrey White and Celine Victoria Berg-Hansen and Chi Zhang},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 2025.8.21},   url = {https://www.csids.no/csstyle/}, }

title: Standardizing Outputs in the CSIDS Style
text: csstyle comprehensive styling system consistent visual outputs using CSIDS guidelines. provides ggplot2 themes, color palettes, dual formatting functions standardize graphs, tables, reports. Key Features: ggplot2 themes CSIDS styling configurable options Color palettes hierarchical system (primary, warning, posneg) Norwegian formatting domestic reports (comma decimal, space thousands, ‚ÄúIK‚Äù missing) Journal formatting academic publications (decimal point, comma thousands, ‚ÄúNA‚Äù missing) Number formatting percentages, per-100k rates, log transformations Date formatting Norwegian conventions vs ISO 8601 standards package focuses consistency flexibility ensure reproducible, professional outputs across different research contexts. Run help(package="csstyle") information.

title: Standardizing Outputs in the CSIDS Style
text: csverse set R packages developed help solve problems frequently occur performing disease surveillance.
code: install.packages("attrib") install.packages("cs9") install.packages("csalert") install.packages("csdata") install.packages("csdb") install.packages("csmaps") install.packages("csstyle") install.packages("cstidy") install.packages("cstime") install.packages("csutil") install.packages("org") install.packages("plnr")

code: # Format current date/time using Norwegian conventions format_date_as_nor() #> [1] "21.08.2025" format_datetime_as_nor() #> [1] "21.08.2025 kl. 15:34"  # Format specific dates format_date_as_nor(as.Date("2023-12-25")) #> [1] "25.12.2023" format_datetime_as_file(as.POSIXct("2023-12-25 14:30:00")) #> [1] "2023_12_25_143000"

what: Convert Norwegian location codes to factor with readable labels ‚Äî format_location_code_as_factor
title: Convert Norwegian location codes to factor with readable labels ‚Äî format_location_code_as_factor

title: Convert Norwegian location codes to factor with readable labels ‚Äî format_location_code_as_factor
code: format_location_code_as_factor(   x,   label = NULL,   label_if_not_unique = NULL,   reference = csdata::nor_locations_names(),   direction = 1 )  format_location_code_as_character(   x,   label = NULL,   label_if_not_unique = NULL,   reference = csdata::nor_locations_names(),   direction = 1 )

title: Convert Norwegian location codes to factor with readable labels ‚Äî format_location_code_as_factor
text: x Character vector Norwegian location codes label Column name reference data use labels (default: uses global setting) label_if_not_unique Column name use location names unique (default: uses global setting) reference Data.table location reference data (default: csdata::nor_locations_names()) direction Integer: 1 normal order, -1 reversed order (default: 1)

title: Convert Norwegian location codes to factor with readable labels ‚Äî format_location_code_as_factor

what: Save ggplot in A4 scale ‚Äî save_a4
title: Save ggplot in A4 scale ‚Äî save_a4
text: Saves ggplot2 plot A4 paper dimensions.

title: Save ggplot in A4 scale ‚Äî save_a4
code: save_a4(q, filename, landscape = T, scaling_factor = 1)

title: Save ggplot in A4 scale ‚Äî save_a4
text: q ggplot2 plot object save filename Character string specifying output filename (extension) landscape Logical indicating plot use landscape orientation (default: TRUE) scaling_factor Numeric scaling factor A4 dimensions (default: 1)

title: Save ggplot in A4 scale ‚Äî save_a4
text: Nothing (called side effects).

title: Save ggplot in A4 scale ‚Äî save_a4
code: library(ggplot2)  # Create a plot p <- ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = hp)) +    geom_point() +    theme_cs()  if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Save in landscape A4 save_a4(p, "myplot.png")  # Save in portrait A4 with larger scaling save_a4(p, "myplot_large.png", landscape = FALSE, scaling_factor = 1.5) } # }

what: ggplot2 color scale using CSIDS color palettes ‚Äî scale_color_cs
title: ggplot2 color scale using CSIDS color palettes ‚Äî scale_color_cs
text: Creates discrete color scale ggplot2 using predefined CSIDS color palettes.

title: ggplot2 color scale using CSIDS color palettes ‚Äî scale_color_cs
code: scale_color_cs(..., palette = "primary", direction = 1)

title: ggplot2 color scale using CSIDS color palettes ‚Äî scale_color_cs
text: ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale() palette Name color palette use (default: "primary"). Options: "primary", "warning", "posneg" direction Direction color palette: 1 normal, -1 reversed (default: 1)

title: ggplot2 color scale using CSIDS color palettes ‚Äî scale_color_cs
text: ggplot2 discrete color scale

title: ggplot2 color scale using CSIDS color palettes ‚Äî scale_color_cs
code: library(ggplot2)  # Default primary color scale ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = hp, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point() +   scale_color_cs()   # Use warning palette ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = hp, color = factor(cyl))) +   geom_point() +   scale_color_cs(palette = "warning")

what: ggplot2 fill scale using CSIDS color palettes ‚Äî scale_fill_cs
title: ggplot2 fill scale using CSIDS color palettes ‚Äî scale_fill_cs
text: Creates discrete fill scale ggplot2 using predefined CSIDS color palettes.

title: ggplot2 fill scale using CSIDS color palettes ‚Äî scale_fill_cs
code: scale_fill_cs(..., palette = "primary", direction = 1)

title: ggplot2 fill scale using CSIDS color palettes ‚Äî scale_fill_cs
text: ... Additional arguments passed ggplot2::discrete_scale() palette Name color palette use (default: "primary"). Options: "primary", "warning", "posneg" direction Direction color palette: 1 normal, -1 reversed (default: 1)

title: ggplot2 fill scale using CSIDS color palettes ‚Äî scale_fill_cs
text: ggplot2 discrete fill scale

title: ggplot2 fill scale using CSIDS color palettes ‚Äî scale_fill_cs
code: library(ggplot2)  # Default primary fill scale ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = factor(cyl), fill = factor(cyl))) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_cs()   # Use posneg palette ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = factor(vs), fill = factor(vs))) +   geom_bar() +   scale_fill_cs(palette = "posneg")

what: Set global configuration parameters for location code formatting ‚Äî set_global
title: Set global configuration parameters for location code formatting ‚Äî set_global
text: function sets global parameters control location codes formatted throughout package.

title: Set global configuration parameters for location code formatting ‚Äî set_global
code: set_global(   location_code_to_factor_label = "location_name",   location_code_to_factor_label_if_not_unique = "location_name_description_nb" )

title: Set global configuration parameters for location code formatting ‚Äî set_global
text: location_code_to_factor_label Column name use location labels (default: "location_name") location_code_to_factor_label_if_not_unique Column name use location names unique (default: "location_name_description_nb")

title: Set global configuration parameters for location code formatting ‚Äî set_global
text: NULL (invisibly) - function called side effects

title: Set global configuration parameters for location code formatting ‚Äî set_global
code: # Set global location formatting preferences set_global(   location_code_to_factor_label = "custom_name",   location_code_to_factor_label_if_not_unique = "custom_description" )  # Reset to defaults set_global()

what: CSIDS ggplot2 theme for consistent styling ‚Äî theme_cs
title: CSIDS ggplot2 theme for consistent styling ‚Äî theme_cs
text: Custom ggplot2 theme following CSIDS visual guidelines configurable grid lines formatting.

title: CSIDS ggplot2 theme for consistent styling ‚Äî theme_cs
code: theme_cs(   base_size = 16,   base_family = "",   base_line_size = base_size/22,   base_rect_size = base_size/22,   legend_position = "right",   x_axis_vertical = FALSE,   panel_on_top = TRUE,   panel.grid.major.x = FALSE,   panel.grid.minor.x = FALSE,   panel.grid.major.y = TRUE,   panel.grid.minor.y = TRUE )  set_x_axis_vertical()

title: CSIDS ggplot2 theme for consistent styling ‚Äî theme_cs
text: base_size Base font size points (default: 16) base_family Base font family (default: "") base_line_size Base line size relative base_size (default: base_size/22) base_rect_size Base rectangle size relative base_size (default: base_size/22) legend_position Position legend: "right", "left", "top", "bottom", "none" (default: "right") x_axis_vertical Logical: x-axis labels vertical? (default: FALSE) panel_on_top Logical: panel drawn top data? (default: TRUE) panel.grid.major.x Logical element: major vertical grid lines (default: FALSE) panel.grid.minor.x Logical element: minor vertical grid lines (default: FALSE) panel.grid.major.y Logical element: major horizontal grid lines (default: TRUE) panel.grid.minor.y Logical element: minor horizontal grid lines (default: TRUE)

title: CSIDS ggplot2 theme for consistent styling ‚Äî theme_cs
text: Complete ggplot2 theme object ggplot2 theme component

title: CSIDS ggplot2 theme for consistent styling ‚Äî theme_cs
code: library(ggplot2)  # Basic usage with default settings ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = hp)) +   geom_point() +   theme_cs()   # With custom settings ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = mpg, y = hp)) +   geom_point() +   theme_cs(legend_position = "bottom", x_axis_vertical = TRUE)  library(ggplot2)  # Add vertical x-axis labels to any plot ggplot(mtcars, aes(x = rownames(mtcars), y = mpg)) +   geom_col() +   set_x_axis_vertical()

title: View HTML in the RStudio viewer ‚Äî view_html
code:
# View simple HTML content html_content <- "

Hello World

" if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ view_html(html_content) } # }

title: Version 2025.8.19
text: Updated version August 2025 release

title: Version 2025.1.31
text: Dual formatting system: Added complete journal formatting functions alongside existing Norwegian formatting Journal number formatting: 15 new functions (format_num_as_journal_*) international standards (comma thousands, decimal point, ‚ÄúNA‚Äù missing) Journal date formatting: 3 new functions using ISO 8601 standards (format_date_as_journal, format_datetime_as_journal, format_datetime_as_journal_file) Comprehensive test suite: Added 79 tests across 5 test files covering formatting functions Complete vignette: New vignette side--side comparisons Norwegian vs journal formatting

title: Version 2025.1.31
text: Reorganized pkgdown.yml: Functions now grouped user intent (Visualization, Norwegian formatting, Journal formatting) instead technical implementation Updated DESCRIPTION: Comprehensive description reflecting dual formatting capabilities Enhanced README.md: Updated key features dual formatting system overview Function examples: Added runnable examples 37+ exported functions Internal documentation: Added @noRd non-exported helper functions

title: Version 2025.1.31
text: Removed outdated files: Cleaned 11 development files old vignette directories Non-portable files: Removed .DS_Store files CRAN compliance Updated LICENSE: Year updated 2025 Created CLAUDE.md: Added development guidance lessons learned

title: Version 2025.1.31
text: Fixed version format: Removed leading zeroes (2025.01.31 ‚Üí 2025.1.31) Enhanced documentation: Fixed missing documentation improved function organization

title: Version 2023.12.22
text: Bug fix format_location_code_as_character function (line assignment error) Internal function documentation improvements Package preparation CRAN submission

title: Version 2023.4.21
text: Reintroduction plot_epicurve Vignette epicurves Vignette cstyle

title: Version 2023.4.18
text: Consistent renaming formatting functions.
